result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Jose Santiago Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $300.00 bond applied, Defendant to submit DNA Sample

Defendant Carlos Jose Santiago Gonzalez in court with attorney Roberto R. Ledesma and Spanish Interpreter Fayme Filipiak sworn.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Court sentences defendant to: $705.00 fine/costs, defendant to submit DNA Sample, bond to be applied, 4 days sentence credit,
Plea hearing on July 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
